com.mesosphere.sdk.offer

Class OfferRequirement

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.offer.OfferRequirement

  • public class OfferRequirement
extends java.lang.Object
    An OfferRequirement encapsulates the needed resources that an org.apache.mesos.Protos.Offer must have in order to launch a task against that org.apache.mesos.Protos.Offer. In general these are Resource requirements, such as requiring a certain amount of cpu, memory, and disk, as encapsulated by TaskRequirement and ExecutorRequirement. More dynamic requirements may also be defined on the placement of the new task, as evaluated by the provided PlacementRules.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static OfferRequirement create(java.lang.String taskType,
                                      int index,
                                      java.util.Collection<TaskInfo> taskInfos,
                                      java.util.Optional<ExecutorInfo> executorInfoOptional,
                                      java.util.Optional<PlacementRule> placementRuleOptional)
                               throws InvalidRequirementException
        Creates a new OfferRequirement.
        Parameters:
        taskType - the task type name from the TaskSet, used for placement filtering
        taskInfos - the 'draft' TaskInfos from which task requirements should be generated
        executorInfoOptional - the executor from which an executor requirement should be generated, if any
        placementRuleOptional - the placement constraints which should be applied to the tasks, if any
        Throws:
        InvalidRequirementException - if task or executor requirements could not be generated from the provided information
